H4633.def: literally: arrangement of heart; hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds in order to determine a detailed course of action that will achieve a certain purpose

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H4617.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2134.def: = state in which a substance has not been mixed or adulterated with any other substance

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H8505.def: = action by which humans or deities determine the weight or size of an object

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5352.def: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which a city is deprived of its inhabitants

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H7081.def: = action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H4456.def: = rain that falls during the first half of April, before the harvest; ► provides the moisture that is crucial for the grains to mature; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH ({A:ABD})

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H4546.def: = a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H1347.def: = dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H1363.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H1343.def: = state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H4986.def: = state in which a condition is experienced as pleasing

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H4726.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of life and well-being

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H5278.def: = state in which a deity has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H6688.def: = hexagonal wax structure ◄ formed by bees ► which contains honey, pollen and eggs; ≈ associated with sweetness and health

H1706.def: = sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

H4966.def: = state in which food tastes well

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4832.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H404.def: = causative action by which part of the human body constrains its owner to do something

H1100.def: possible literal meaning: without benefit or without success; hence:  = state in which someone is considered an objectional human being who is engaged in evil behavior and does not contribute to the society in a positive way

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H8419.def: literally: crookedness; hence: = state in which humans cannot be trusted to do the right thing or make the right choices in life

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H4066.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H7279.def: = action by which humans speak with anger and resentment

H6504.def: = process by which an object is split up into smaller units

H441.def: = person in a position of leadership over a tribe or clan

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H6095.def: literally: to squint (one's) eyes; hence, probably: = action by which humans keep their eyes partly closed when they are planning an activity; ≈ associated with evil

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H8419.def: literally: crookedness; hence: = state in which humans cannot be trusted to do the right thing or make the right choices in life

H7169.def: = causative action by which humans press their lips together, ≈ which is associated with evil intent

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H2904.def: = causative action by which humans throw an object in a certain direction, often with force

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
